bioghist.p: Charles Lennox-Gordon was born on 3 August 1791. He was the eldest son of Charles, 4th Duke of Richmond and Lennox (1764-1819). He was a Lieutenant-Colonel in the army and served in the latter stages of the war against Napoleon, and was at Waterloo. He was an aide-de-camp to Queen Victoria and was the Hereditary Constable of Inverness Castle. Charles Lennox-Gordon, 5th Duke of Richmond and Lennox, died on 21 October 1860.

scopecontent.p: The material consists of a small number of letters.

otherfindaid.p: Important finding aids generally are: the alphabetical Index to Manuscripts held at Edinburgh University Library, Special Collections and Archives, consisting of typed slips in sheaf binders and to which additions were made until 1987; and the Index to Accessions Since 1987.

relatedmaterial.p: The local Indexes show various references to other material related to the Dukes of Richmond in the Laing Collection and elsewhere (check the Indexes for more details): document signed by Charles Lennox, 1st Duke of Richmond and Lennox (1672-1723) resigning into the hands of the Crown his office of Heritable Admiral of Scotland, at La.II.575; letters of Charles Lennox, 3rd Duke of Richmond and Lennox (1734-1806) to George Johnstone, 1775, at La.II.73/107, 115, 186-187; letter from Charles Lennox, 4th Duke of Richmond and Lennox (1764-1819), to Lord Mountjoy, 1811, at La.II.422/173; letter of Charlotte, Dowager Duchess of Richmond to Lady Charles Fitzroy, 1841, at Gen. 1983/44; letter to Bramston about the price of wool, 1865, and letter to Wyllie, at Gen. 1983/37, also engraved portrait and signature, 1874, of Charles Henry Gordon-Lennox, 6th Duke of Gordon and Lennox (1818-1903), at Gen. 1995/83.

In addition, the UK National Register of Archives (NRA), updated by the Historical Manuscripts Commission, notes: correspondence and papers, West Sussex Record Office, Ref. Goodwood MSS NRA 850 Gordon Lennox; and, letters (13) to Aretas Akers-Douglas, 1886-1894, Centre for Kentish Studies, Ref. U564 NRA 9550 Akers-Douglas.
